title: Trend or aberration? Russia is launching foreign satellites again
description: Major space industry players are still keeping Russia at arm's length.

title: The Linux coders turning the ROG Ally and other handhelds into Steam Deck clones
description: It's not an easy process, but it's getting close to a nearly full SteamOS feel.

title: Malaria spreading in Texas and Florida; first US-based cases in two decades
description: Despite cases in Texas and Florida, the overall risk is considered "extremely low."

title: Tesla on Autopilot crashed into stopped truck during highway lane closure
description: Tesla hit truck that was providing traffic control for a highway lane closure.

title: Twitter gets buggier: Followers don’t display, users restricted in error
description: Twitter looking into a bug restricting some users from liking and retweeting.

title: EV startup Lordstown Motors files for bankruptcy protection
description: Struggling company accuses Taiwanese group Foxconn of reneging on commitments.

title: Bethesda exec was “confused” over double standard for multi-console Call of Duty
description: CoD policy was "the opposite" of what Bethesda was "told to do... What's the difference?"

title: The one-shot drug that keeps on dosing
description: What if a single shot lasted for months?

title: Prominent cryptocurrency exchange infected with previously unseen Mac malware
description: It's not yet clear how the full-featured JokerSpy backdoor gets installed.
